title: Ingmar.Bergman.A.Passion.1969.XviD
description: As he rifles through a purse left by Anna Fromm (Liv Ullman), he finds a letter with a phrase that warns of &#039;physical and psychical actsof violence&#039;. His seduction (or redemption) by the world moves dramatically to confirm that phrase. Into the grays, browns and greens of Bergman&#039;s newly mastered color palette, burst the reds that threatens to become the sign of any human relationship--the deeper, the more violence necessary to break through to the other person. With Persona, The Passion of Anna marks the high-point of Bergman&#039;s achievement in the sixties. Liberated from any direct confrontation with theology, Bergman here translates his concerns into new terms. &#039;Why don&#039;t you do something you believe in?&#039; Anna asks the architect, and Bergman&#039;s Brechtian cinematic practices are this film&#039;s answer.
